intro: Hedlundia luristanica, commonly known as the Luristan bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Hedlundia luristanica has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
